result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam Jor-El Perry

records.addlTxt:
11:59 a.m.  State's inducement of 10/19/22.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  12/2/22, 8:30 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.    Preliminary hearing is set for 10-20-22 at 10:30 a.m.    
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter to Judge Re: Defendants Remote Appearance Request
Adjourned initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Initial appearance is reset to 09-26-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender more time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.
Re:  Possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver, on 08-22-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

$500.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.  
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Roselyn Perry, 384 Windward Road, Green Bay, WI  54302

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess methamphetamine and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-29-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release, defendant is to have no contact with Jessica Fenlon and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
